ai-mil3.7.16:0.3_0: Two on the matters of the Dhamma, which is difficult to get by.
ai-mil3.7.16:1.2_0: “Venerable Sir, did the Fortunate One see austerities?”
ai-mil3.7.16:1.4_0: “It’s too hard, great king, for the Buddha.”
ai-mil3.7.16:1.5_0: “But, sir, did the dragon take austerities?”
ai-mil3.7.16:1.6_0: “Great king, this has been done by the Buddha, and this is the one thing, that is to say, the mind-made, the feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness. That is: ‘This is the feeling’?”
ai-mil3.7.16:2.2_0: “Now, great king, if you were to plunge into the ocean and emerge from the water and confluence, saying: ‘This person would take water on the bank of the Ganges, great king, that person’s Yamunā, and that water is the water in the ocean.’”
ai-mil3.7.16:2.4_0: “Great king, this is one thing! The mind-made, who hasn’t done enough to wield the many kinds of contact, that is: ‘This is the perception, this is the end of feeling’?”
ai-mil3.7.16:3.1_0: Immeasurable in the world, (wholesome) lucky, deluded into the darkness,
ai-mil3.7.16:4.1_0: The seventh sub-chapter on naturally formlessly is finished.
